author: BarryNolte
body: mc.exe would fail to run if the path/filename had a space in it.  Added quotes to avoid this.

comments.author: msftclas
comments.body: Hi **@BarryNolte**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution! This seems like a small (but important) contribution, so no Contribution License Agreement is required at this point. Real humans will now evaluate your PR. TTYL, MSBOT;

comments.author: vors
comments.body: Good catch! Can you, please [rebase](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/master/docs/git#sync-your-local-repo), to avoid unnecessary merge commit?

comments.author: keradus
comments.body: @vors why not just squash during merging ? :)

comments.author: BarryNolte
comments.body: This comes from my inability to have git do what I want it to the first sixteen times I try to do something :) Can it be squashed on merge?

comments.author: vors
comments.body: Oh, right :) GitHub added it. Never tried it before.

comments.author: vors
comments.body: Hm, looks like it will require some additional work to enable. At the moment there is no such option. cc @andschwa can you take a look? I'm on mobile at the moment

title: [build.psm1] - mc.exe input file needs quotes
